details:
Three issues were discovered in SQLite, a popular embedded database:


* [CVE-2020-35525](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-35525): Prevent a potential null pointer deference issue in INTERSEC query processing.
* [CVE-2020-35527](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2020-35527): Prevent an out-of-bounds access issue that could be exploited via ALTER TABLE in views that have a nested FROM clauses.


For Debian 10 Buster, these problems have been fixed in version
3.27.2-3+deb10u2.


We recommend that you upgrade your sqlite3 packages.


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
